channel.title: Github on interesting things
channel.description: Recent content in Github on interesting things

item.title: Verified GitHub commits with Keybase
item.description: A while back, GitHub announced support for GPG signature verification. Now, git has supported signing commits and tags for a while, but it was a pain to manually verify signed commits, so I’m not sure the average developer even considered it. I saw the announcement, and messed around with it for a few minutes then forgot about it, because I don’t use GPG very often, and it hadn’t yet clicked that Keybase is really just a GPG management tool…
